lu.uni.lassy.excalibur.examples.icrash.dev.controller

Class AbstractUserController

  • java.lang.Object
    • lu.uni.lassy.excalibur.examples.icrash.dev.controller.AbstractController
      • lu.uni.lassy.excalibur.examples.icrash.dev.controller.AbstractUserController
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    HasListeners
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AdminController, CoordinatorController

    public abstract class AbstractUserController
extends AbstractController
implements HasListeners
    The Class AbstractUserController, used for generic functions that are done by both administrators and coordinators.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private ActProxyAuthenticated _auth
      Parameter that has a ProxyActor that allows actors to do functions on the server.
      protected static Server server
      Parameter that allows the system to gain server access, the server function lives in the model of the client and has RMI calls to access the server.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Modifier Constructor and Description
      protected AbstractUserController(ActProxyAuthenticated auth)
      Instantiates a new abstract user controller, this holds the methods that either a coordinator or an administrator should be able to access.

    • Field Detail

      • server

        protected static Server server
        Parameter that allows the system to gain server access, the server function lives in the model of the client and has RMI calls to access the server.

      • _auth

        private ActProxyAuthenticated _auth
        Parameter that has a ProxyActor that allows actors to do functions on the server. These are functions that require users to be logged in to perform, like the addCoordinator. It will be set at moment of initialisation

    • Constructor Detail

      • AbstractUserController

        protected AbstractUserController(ActProxyAuthenticated auth)
        Instantiates a new abstract user controller, this holds the methods that either a coordinator or an administrator should be able to access.
        Parameters:
        auth - The ActProxyAuth class that sets Actor associated with this controller

    • Method Detail

      • oeLogin

        public PtBoolean oeLogin(java.lang.String login,
                         java.lang.String password)
                  throws ServerOfflineException,
                         ServerNotBoundException
        The method that allows the user to logon.
        Parameters:
        login - The username to logon with
        password - The password to use
        Returns:
        The success of the method
        Throws:
        ServerOfflineException - Thrown if the server is currently offline
        ServerNotBoundException - Thrown if the server hasn't been bound in the RMI settings

      • oeLogout

        public PtBoolean oeLogout()
                   throws ServerOfflineException,
                          ServerNotBoundException
        The method that allows the user to logoff.
        Returns:
        The success of the method
        Throws:
        ServerOfflineException - Thrown if the server is currently offline
        ServerNotBoundException - Thrown if the server hasn't been bound in the RMI settings

      • getUserType

        public ActProxyAuthenticated.UserType getUserType()
        Gets the type of user that is currently logged on. It will return either a coordinator or a administrator
        Returns:
        Returns an enum of type UserType, found in the class ActProxyAuthenticatedImpl

      • getAuth

        public ActProxyAuthenticated getAuth()
        Returns the ActProxyAuthenticated user, which is used to call methods that only a logged in user should be able to do. The user will need casting first, so use instanceof to confirm user type
        Returns:
        Returns an implemented ActProxyAuthenticated user type, that can be used to call methods that the user has done. An example is oeHandleCrisis

      • getAuthImpl

        public ActProxyAuthenticatedImpl getAuthImpl()
        Returns the ActProxyAuthenticatedImpl user, which is used to call methods that only a logged in user should be able to do. The user will need casting first, so use instanceof to confirm user type. This uses the Impl version for getting client specific methods, like the list of messages
        Returns:
        The client side actor proxy for the implemented authenticated

      • removeAllListeners

        public void removeAllListeners()
                        throws ServerOfflineException,
                               ServerNotBoundException
        Description copied from interface: HasListeners
        Removes all the listeners associated with this window.
        Specified by:
        removeAllListeners in interface HasListeners
        Throws:
        ServerOfflineException - Thrown if the server is offline
        ServerNotBoundException - Thrown if the server has not been bound correctly in the RMI settings

      • getActorFromClassType

        public ActAuthenticated getActorFromClassType(CtAuthenticated aCtAuthenticated)
                                       throws ServerOfflineException,
                                              ServerNotBoundException
        Using the provided class type (E.g. CtAdministrator), this method will retrieve the associated actor for that user from the server
        Parameters:
        aCtAuthenticated - The class type to use to search for the associated actor
        Returns:
        The ActAuthenticated associated with the class type passed. This could be null if none is found
        Throws:
        ServerOfflineException - Thrown if the server is offline
        ServerNotBoundException - Thrown if the server has not been bound correctly in the RMI settings
